value.title: Triggering Flag ID
value.comment: Turns off when this flag is activated.

value.title: Roulette Block Content
value.comment: If the object is a roulette block, this specifies what's inside. Convert to a list please...

list.title: Object
list.comment: The object/sprite that appears when the Whomp drops down.

list.title: Moon Coin Number
list.comment: If the object is a moon coin, this specifies whether it's the first, second or third moon coin.

value.title: Triggering Flag ID
value.comment: Turns off when this flag ID is activated

value.title: Triggering Flag ID
value.comment: If this is rising lava, this flag triggers the rising movement.

sprite.name: Cloud BG Effect
sprite.notes: Creates an horizontal line of clouds

value.title: Triggering Flag ID
value.comment: If this is rising water, this flag triggers the rising movement.

value.title: Triggering Flag ID
value.comment: Creates/destroys tile when this is triggered.

checkbox.title: Destroy
checkbox.comment: Destroys the blocks in the area specified by the height and width values.

value.title: Target Flag ID (Flag On)
value.comment: Triggers Flag ID when exploded by Bob-omb.

sprite.name: Special Exit Controller
sprite.notes: Interestingly, in 1-1 A1, this is linked to an entrance that isn't used as an exit. Also, maybe this has more functions than its predecessor in NSMBW?

sprite.name: Invisible Block
sprite.notes: Never used with sprite data. Unused values are very likely to exist.

sprite.name: Flying Away Question Block
sprite.notes: Unknown difference from Flying Question Block (024)

list.title: Content
list.comment: This powerup will be in-between the Super Mushroom first and 1-up Mushroom last. Values beyond 4 are unused

sprite.name: POW Block Manager
sprite.notes: Place this on top of the POW block tile to make the POW block perform its function. No settings used.

sprite.name: Bob-omb
sprite.notes: Only used without spritedata. Unused values are very likely to exist.

list.title: Unknown Value 6
list.comment: Most likely determines the world number.

value.title: Size?
value.comment: Might be a checkbox as well...

sprite.name: Swinging Chain
sprite.notes: Only used in Ludwig boss battle (world 5). Probably reverse engineering required to figure out the nybble values.

value.title: Unknown Value 5
value.comment: 10 used in the centered chain. 4 in the other chains. Maybe makes Ludwig able to swing on it when he has been hit 2 times?

value.title: Unknown Value 11
value.comment: Some kind of ID? 0 used for the most left chain, 1 for the chain next to chain 0, ..., 4 for the most right chain.

list.title: Pause at the end of each rotation

value.title: Rotation ID
value.comment: Use this ID to assign objects to this sprite.

value.title: Triggering Flag ID
value.comment: The assigned objects rotate if this Flag ID is activated.

value.title: Alternate Rotation ID
value.comment: Only used when the rotation ID is 2, and it seems that this is able to link (Star) coins as well... Testing is needed.

list.title: Mode
list.comment: Defines how the coins move

sprite.name: Coin in Bubble
sprite.notes: Horizontal movement direction is determined by Mario's position. Moves towards Mario.

value.title: Triggering Flag ID
value.comment: Wait, wat? a triggering flag ID? Some explanation is needed.

value.title: Time activated?
value.comment: Would be in game seconds then...

list.title: Mode
list.comment: Defines how the coins move
list.entry: One coin moves up and down once

value.title: Unknown Value 2
value.comment: Sometimes this nybble is used, sometimes the other nybble is used. Really weird.

value.title: Rotation ID
value.comment: Make this ID match with the one you set on the Rotation Controller to assign this coin to it.

value.title: Unknown Value 1
value.comment: Also part of the Red Coin ID?

value.title: Red Coin ID
value.comment: Use this to link the red coin ring to this coin.

value.title: Unknown Value 10
value.comment: Parachute related? Might be parachute swing direction.

list.title: Unknown Value 5
list.comment: Enemy type?

list.title: Unknown Value 10
list.comment: Enemy nybble is 10 in NSMBDS, 11 in NSMBWii...

sprite.name: Flag Controller - Chainer (If X, do Y)
sprite.notes: Judging by similarly named NSMBW sprite...

sprite.name: Flag Controller - "IF" (Uses Locations)
sprite.notes: Currently missing player powerup (small, super, fire) and player status (standing, jumping) detection. For now, I just use the setup of NSMBW. If this proves wrong feel free to change it!

value.title: Target Flag ID
value.comment: This flag ID is activated when conditions are met.

list.title: Required Player Position
list.comment: Ignored if sprite is "Ignoring Player Location".

checkbox.title: No enemies in Player Location
checkbox.comment: As judging by 10-1 A1Z1(DLC), where flag 5 is triggered when the player is in location 1, and the enemies (Goomba Tower) isn't.

sprite.name: Flag Controller - Multi-Chainer (If X, do Y THROUGH Z)

value.title: End Flag ID
value.comment: The activator will trigger all Flags from the start Flag ID to this Flag ID (including this one). The Value entered here must be larger than the Value entered for 'Start Flag ID'

value.title: Start Flag ID
value.comment: The activator will start running when this Flag ID is triggered.

sprite.name: Flag Controller - Onscreen
sprite.notes: Activates the target flag id when the game has scrolled so far that this sprite would be visible on the screen if it was not invisible. So it basically activates when it enters the screen.

sprite.name: Scuttlebug
sprite.notes: Perhaps has unused values to make it walk around like in NSMBDS?

list.title: Movement
list.entry: Moves down slowly, then goes back up slowly.
Falls down, then goes back up slowly.

list.title: Direction
list.comment: Repeats after 7...

sprite.name: Goal Pole (Flagpole)
sprite.notes: This sprite is sometimes used on the top block of a 1x10 invisible solid.

checkbox.title: Secret Exit
checkbox.comment: Turns it into a secret exit, which looks different and makes a different path on the Map if there's a secret there.

sprite.name: GroupId (Snake Block related)
sprite.notes: This sprite is needed for Snake Blocks to work. (?)

value.title: GroupID
value.comment: Use this to link this sprite to a Snake Block.

list.title: block's pysical rotation?
list.comment: rotation is from bottom left corner

sprite.name: Springboard
sprite.notes: Has 10: 'Shift 1/2 tile right' and 11: 'Big (Unused)' checkboxes in NSMBDS. Has 5: 'Remember Position', 10: 'Place Behind Other Sprites' and 11: ' Shift 1/2 tile right (Unused)' in NSMBW.

sprite.name: Signboard
sprite.notes: Can be affected by gravity, like NSMBU's and unlike NSMBDS's and NSMBW's.

list.title: Unknown Value 5
list.comment: Does various, (seemingly) unrelated things...

list.title: Inscription
list.comment: This nybble determines what the sign says. This value goes from 0-15, so research is needed to figure out what all unused nybbles produce. There are only arrow and fireball textures, so there will only be repetitions.

checkbox.title: World 9 specifics
checkbox.comment: Only checked in 9-16 A3. Must cause all differences from the battle in W6.

sprite.name: Bowser Fire
sprite.notes: Bowser Head Statue fire and maybe Bowser fire.

value.title: Width
value.comment: Width of the platform in blocks.

value.title: Distance
value.comment: Specifies the distance the platform moves in blocks.

sprite.name: Direction Switch Platform
sprite.notes: It is still at first, it starts moving when landed on. After that it reverses direction when landed on. Values 15 and 4 for Unknown Values 5 and 6 make the platform move up and down. Values 2 and 6 make it move upright-downright.

list.title: Direction
list.comment: Might as well be a checkbox...

sprite.name: Wheel Platform (Four)
sprite.notes: Can tread water and/or follow lines.

sprite.name: Vertical Camera Limit Left
sprite.notes: This sprite seems to accept an Flag ID to be disabled...

value.title: Unknown Value 10
value.comment: Checkbox? Perhaps defines whether this is the bottom one.

value.title: Unknown Value 11
value.comment: Checkbox? Perhaps defines whether this is the top one.

sprite.name: Vertical Camera Limit Right
sprite.notes: This sprite seems to accept an Flag ID to be disabled...

list.title: Starting Orientation
list.comment: For values 2 and 3, the side between brackets is the side of the wall you need to place the sprite.

sprite.name: Pipe Venus Fire Trap (Fire Piranha) Facing Down
Pipe Venus Fire Trap (Fire Piranha) Facing Left
Pipe Venus Fire Trap (Fire Piranha) Facing Right
Pipe Venus Fire Trap (Fire Piranha) Facing Up
Pipe Bone Piranha Plant Facing Up (UNUSED)
Pipe Bone Piranha Plant Facing Left
Pipe Bone Piranha Plant Facing Right
Path Controller
sprite.notes: Basically connects other sprites to paths. Used for the Gold Ship, among others.

value.title: Triggering Flag ID
value.comments: Values higher than 15 never used, so whether it's a combined value is uncertain...

value.title: Triggering Flag ID (UNUSED)
value.comment: A wild guess... Test if this is actually true, since it is never used in the retail game...

value.title: Triggering Flag ID
value.comment: Values higher than 15 never used, so this may not be a combined value...

value.title: Triggering Flag ID
value.comment: Values higher than 15 never used, so this may not be a combined value...

checkbox.title: Spin counter-clockwise
checkbox.comment: If this is checked, the circle will rotate counter-clockwise.

value.title: Radius
value.comment: This nybble determines the radius (the amount of space between the circle itself, and the center of the circle (=this sprite)).

value.title: Amount of places
value.comment: Value + 1. This determines the amount of places at which either a cheep cheep, a coin or nothing can be spawned.

value.title: Unknown Combined(?) Value 13-14
value.comment: A weird value. Could have something to do with the contents of the circle.

checkbox.title: Coin Circle (?)
checkbox.comment: Probably this is correct. Needs some triple-checking though.

value.title: Unknown Combined(?) Value 15-16
value.comment: A weird value. Could have something to do with the contents of the circle.

sprite.name: Unknown Sprite: "RailLimit"
sprite.notes: Uses paths, but strangely, the paths speed and acceleration are set to 0. Maybe it's another way of limiting the camera...

value.title: Path ID
value.comment: It does something with this path. What exactly? Good question...

value.title: Red Coin ID
value.comment: Use this to link red coins to this ring.

list.title: Reward
list.comment: The reward. Exact values are unknown at the moment. Feel free to test them!

value.title: Gold Ring Related Flag
value.comment: Can also trigger sprites like the Coin Spawners...

value.title: Unknown Value 6
value.comment: Probably decides which side it is

sprite.name: Cannon Camera Controller
sprite.notes: Used in 1-Cannon. Used underneath EnvStarTag, below view, inside EnvStarTag’s location.

checkbox.title: Rotates
checkbox.comment: Makes it change direction after every shot

value.title: Unknown Value 10
value.comment: 9 and 10 are the only values used...

value.title: Path ID
value.comment: Together with the overflow, this nybble forms the Path ID. It works as follows: For Path ID 27 (1*16+11*1), you need to fill in 11 here, and 1 at the Path ID overflow.

value.title: Path ID overflow
value.comment: This nybble works as follows: For Path ID 27 (1*16+11*1), you need to fill in 1 here, and 11 at the Path ID.

sprite.name: Snake Block Synchronizer (Manager)
sprite.notes: Seems to be the Snake Block itself, but it could also manage the path the snake block uses. Paths are being checked...

value.title: Path ID
value.comment: Together with the overflow, this nybble forms the Path ID. It works as follows: For Path ID 27 (1*16+11*1), you need to fill in 11 here, and 1 at the Path ID overflow.

value.title: Path ID overflow
value.comment: This nybble works as follows: For Path ID 27 (1*16+11*1), you need to fill in 1 here, and 11 at the Path ID.

value.title: Group ID
value.comment: Use this ID to link it to a GroupID (98)

value.title: Target Flag ID
value.comment: When the star coin is collected, this Flag ID will be activated.

list.title: Star Coin Number
list.comment: Defines which star coin this is.

value.title: Rotation ID?
value.comment: Since the data for both rotation controllers is far from perfect, this might be wrong. However, it follows a pattern...

value.title: Output Flag
value.comment: Creates/destroys tile when this is triggered.

checkbox.title: Upside-Down?
checkbox.comment: Never used, but probably this follows the same pattern as the others...

sprite.name: Mega Spike Ball
sprite.notes: Kinda hard to figure out as it is only used twice in the entire game. Only in world 7-16

sprite.name: Spike Ball Spawner
sprite.notes: Exists in NSMBW, may have similar values to that. Likely to have unused values.

value.title: Triggering Flag ID
value.comment: Starts moving when this flag id is activated

list.title: Moving direction?
list.comment: Specifies a direction

sprite.name: Chain Chomp on Pole
sprite.notes: Place the sprite two blocks below where you want the bottom of the pole to be.

value.title: Unknown Value 6
value.comment: Height of the pole? (1 opposed to 5 blocks)

sprite.name: Rotation Controlled Block-Shaped Platform
sprite.notes: Only used in DLC. Has the appearence of (or similar to) the brown tower block

sprite.name: Powerup
sprite.notes: Is still by default, even with mushrooms, may have settings to make it move normally/have different movement.

list.title: Movement, Sound or Speed?
list.comment: Only 0, 1 and 2 are used...

value.title: Unknown Value 9
value.comment: Spawn movement? Used as 1 in 2-9 A1

list.title: Powerup
list.comment: Many unused values...

sprite.name: Long Question Block
sprite.notes: Always contains two coins plus the item selected in Content.

value.title: Path Controller ID
value.comment: Use this to link this sprite to 188.

sprite.name: Icy Spike Ball
sprite.notes: Likely to have identical sprite data to normal Spike Ball

sprite.name: Big Icy Spike Ball
sprite.notes: Likely to have identical sprite data to normal Big Spike Ball

value.title: Triggering Flag ID
value.comment: Appears when this flag is triggered

value.title: Unknown Value 14
value.comment: Used as 1 with first instances and 2 with last instance in 1-29 (Rainbow) A2. Perhaps something to do with the 100 coin prize?

sprite.name: Long Question Block (Underground)
sprite.notes: Always contains two coins plus the item selected in Content.

list.title: Content
list.comment: Only 1 and 2 are used. Other values are copied from 267.

sprite.name: Long Question Block (Lava)
sprite.notes: Always contains two coins plus the item selected in Content.

list.title: Content
list.comment: Only 1 and 4 used. Other values are a copy of 267.

checkbox.title: Unknown Checkbox 5
checkbox.comment: Used only in 6-16 and 9-16, the two final bowser levels that have two checkpoints. This flag is set at the second checkpoint.

checkbox.title: Does not appear when White Raccoon Suit is used
checkbox.comment: Does not appear when the White Raccoon Suit is used and this is checked.

value.title: Unknown Value 1
value.comment: Combined with 2 to form an flag ID?

value.title: Unknown Value 2
value.comment: Combined with 1 to form an flag ID?

sprite.name: Unknown Sprite: "PlayerBigRes"
sprite.notes: Used in every area with Mega-Mario (World 1-2 A4, World 5-6 A1 and world Mushroom-3 (7-3) A3). Doesn't seem to have settings...

sprite.name: Warp Cannon Signboard
sprite.notes: A big signboard facing right, used at the end of cannon levels. No spritedata used.

sprite.name: Cannon
sprite.notes: This cannon is used in all cannon levels...

sprite.name: Unknown Sprite "BattanRes"
sprite.notes: Battan is the Japanese name of a Whomp, but it cannot be a Whomp, because it is placed in the air. It might be Whomp related though, as it is only used in 9-3 and this level has a lot of standing Whomps. In addition, it is not used in area 2, which does not have a Whomp. Also, no settings used.

value.title: Output Flag (?)
value.comment: Outputs this flag after an animation? Used as 01 in 1-18 A1. Also, nybble 1 is never used, so whether this is a combined value should be checked.

sprite.name: Unknown Sprite: "HakushuKun"
sprite.notes: Used in 1-Cannon. Hakushu is Japanese for "Applause"

sprite.name: Unknown Sprite: "ActorCoinHakusyu"
sprite.notes: Used in 1-Cannon, inside location. Appears to be used in cannons level instead of normal coins.

list.title: Moon Coin Number
list.comment: Determines the moon coin number.

sprite.name: Big Flying Coin
sprite.notes: The large coin flying in all rainbow levels

sprite.name: Inventory Disable (?)
sprite.notes: Used without data in all cannons and rainbow levels...

sprite.name: Warp Cannon "Rush" Effect?
sprite.notes: Used in some cannon levels. Probably creates the "Rush" effect. The effect doesn't really resemble stars though, maybe it used to and they didn't rename the sprite, or maybe it is meant to mean "Shooting Stars", because they do shoot across the screen.

sprite.name: Spore FG Effect
sprite.notes: Makes spores appear in front of the level, like the lava and snow effects. No data...

sprite.name: Path Controlled Platform
sprite.notes: Only used in the cannon levels of the odd-numbered worlds (1,3,5,7 and 9)

sprite.name: Unknown Sprite: "ObjNukiBlock"
sprite.notes: Nuki is Japanase and means "To unplug/To disconnect". No data used.
